0805ed4a-f3e9-41b4-9bfc-29759608e8e7.description: Earners of the Remote Learning 2021 credential have developed self management, digital and communication skills which enable them to make sense of the world with others while off campus. They use critical thinking and time management to make connections between information, ideas and community, also reflected in creative ways of contributing.
0805ed4a-f3e9-41b4-9bfc-29759608e8e7.name: Remote Learning 2021

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: CGGS Learning Design Framework
alignments.description: This badge recognises remote learning skills in 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Working and learning remotely for over 100 days.

dca5792d-e802-492e-b985-d5fa05673e8f.description: The CGGS Remote Working Credential recognises the Connection, Growth, Grit and Success of our staff in ensuring continuity of operations and excellence during lockdown. Earners of the this credential have developed self management, digital and communication skills which enable them to make sense of the world with others. They use critical thinking and time management to make connections between information, ideas and community, also reflected in creative ways of contributing.
dca5792d-e802-492e-b985-d5fa05673e8f.name: Remote Working 2021 (Staff)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: CGGS Learning Design Framework
alignments.description: This badge recognises remote working skills in 2021.

badge_template_activities.title: Working and learning remotely for over 100 days in 2021.

dc5ba97a-f255-40aa-8249-5e6ef132b739.description: An introductory course to using Microsoft Excel undertaken as part of the CGGS Upskill Program. Earners of this badge are introduced to some of Excel's basic capabilities, key terms, formatting, formulas, charts and learn how to navigate the program. They produce a working example of an Excel spreadsheet demonstrating their grasp of all of these functions.
dc5ba97a-f255-40aa-8249-5e6ef132b739.name: Exceler8

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge complete a two hour introduction to Excel as part of the CGGS Upskill program.
Earners of this badge are instructed by a qualified Commerce/Accountancy teacher and must work through a 24 step process to produce a working example of an Excel spreadsheet.

ea9d9eb3-735e-406c-883a-d6221ac6f1e4.description: Earners of the Remote Learning & Working credential have developed foundational skills of self management, digital and communication skills and completed specific briefs in trialing working & learning from home or offsite. These skills are essential for ongoing hybrid learning situations, including critical thinking, time management including working to a deadline, making connections between information, ideas and community, and demonstrating creative ways of contributing.
ea9d9eb3-735e-406c-883a-d6221ac6f1e4.name: Remote Learning & Working Skills+

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: CGGS Learning Design Framework
alignments.description: This badge recognises foundational & essential remote learning skills.

badge_template_activities.title: Meeting the challenge of an Upskill By Design experience including specific design briefs.

9f3dd755-2785-4719-a184-eb5a901dcd3a.description: Earners of this badge have completed the seminar workshops Study Skills Kickstart and Junior Time Management from Elevate Education. In addition, they have completed six complimentary micro-learnings called 'Twenties' designed in partnership with Princes Trust Australia.
9f3dd755-2785-4719-a184-eb5a901dcd3a.name: Foundation Study Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the seminar workshops Study Skills Kickstart and Junior Time Management from Elevate Education.

Earners of this badge have completed six micro-learnings called 'Twenties' designed in partnership with Princes Trust Australia. Submission of proof points associated with these was required to validate this learning. Topics were: avoiding distractions, making time for study & downtime, the pomodoro technique, proof-reading your work, taking better pictures, tackling your least favourite subject.

9aff40bb-35b8-4c3d-9441-be843681bcdc.description: Earners of this badge have completed the RoadSet online learning course, containing 10 modules developed by the Australian Road Safety Foundation. The course is designed to increase road safety awareness skills in young Australians and highlight strategies to help prevent crashes and reduce road trauma.
9aff40bb-35b8-4c3d-9441-be843681bcdc.name: RoadSet Online Course

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum Health and Physical Education
alignments.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate the ability to plan, rehearse and evaluate options for managing situations where their own or others’ health, safety and wellbeing may be at short or long term risk in a road setting.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion and assessment of 10 online learning modules: road user environments, pedestrians, cyclists, rideables, being a passenger, fit for the road, distractions, becoming a driver, driver basics and responsible road users.

skills.name: Behaving in Ways to Protect Self and Others

ec9fe1ad-a7d6-4aa8-a00b-88c9e4078148.description: Earners of the Graphic Recording credential have developed critical thinking and communication skills which enable them to extract key information and make links between ideas and concepts in presentations, videos or written text. They use design elements and principles to make connections between information and to present it in a visually engaging and easily digestible graphic form.
ec9fe1ad-a7d6-4aa8-a00b-88c9e4078148.name: Foundation Graphic Recording

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: CGGS Learning Design Framework
alignments.description: This badge provides one credit towards a critical thinking skills badge and one credit towards a communication skills badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Makes links between key ideas. Uses key words, images and symbols to represent ideas and information
Uses position, colour and symbols such as arrows to make links. Uses design elements & principles to present information graphically.

Creates graphic recordings using digital or non-digital tools to capture messages and links to share with others. Uses digital and non-digital tools to create graphic recordings to communicate learning.
Has completed the online Graphic Recording course designed by the Visual Storytellers Group learning about: note-taking, mind-mapping layout, space and flow, frames, writing neatly, icons and colour.
Has submitted a proof point in the form of a vision board, demonstrating the skills of block lettering, writing neatly, layout, space, flow, icons, colour, frames and using words as pictures.

ac0aa9fd-7e17-49eb-bdc4-d827cf1060a8.description: Earners of the Graphic Recording credential have developed critical thinking and communication skills which enable them to extract key information and make links between ideas and concepts in presentations, videos or written text. They use design elements and principles to make connections between information and to present it in a visually engaging and easily digestible graphic form.
ac0aa9fd-7e17-49eb-bdc4-d827cf1060a8.name: Foundation Graphic Recording 2023

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: CGGS By Design Framework
alignments.description: This badge aligns with the CGGS By Design Learning Architecture.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge undertake a four hour workshop learning the principles and skills of graphic recording, led by an industry expert in this field. The workshop is designed by the Visual Storytellers Group and includes topics on note-taking, mind-mapping layout, space and flow, frames, writing neatly, icons and colour.

Earners produce their own graphic recording. They are able to use key words, images and symbols to represent ideas and information applying design elements and principles to present information graphically.

85dbb4e1-c4a7-45f0-a5af-fb3490cab9b1.description: Earners of this badge have explored the ACHIEVE framework by The Prince's Trust Australia and submitted proof points for each stage, including Who I Am, a skills quiz, Enterprise Skills 'Twenties' and on overview of taking action on an issue they care about.
85dbb4e1-c4a7-45f0-a5af-fb3490cab9b1.name: ACHIEVE Skills Exploration.

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the snapshot experience of the ACHIEVE framework

Earners of this badge have completed micro-learnings called 'Twenties' designed in partnership with Princes Trust Australia. Submission of proof points associated with these was required to validate this learning.

319fa468-f2db-4a94-be73-152f3f7a8797.description: Videos for Change empowers young people with the skills and global competencies to create one-minute videos that inspire empathy, awareness, and action on important social issues on the social issues they care about. Chosen by a panel of industry experts, the winner of the Senior High School Category and and inaugural Animation Award was chosen from hundreds of submissions from around Australia and now appears in the Videos for Change Global Showcase.
319fa468-f2db-4a94-be73-152f3f7a8797.name: Videos for Change Winner 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: The video 'Quicksand' is an animation which reveals how coercive behaviour in a relationship can be abusive and damaging. Full of intricate symbolism, the video contains an original song and soundtrack and industry standard animation and storytelling. Chosen by a panel of industry experts, 'Quicksand' was awarded best video for the Senior High School Category and the inaugural Best Animation Award.

alignments.description: This badge provides 1 credit towards a critical thinking skills badge and 2 credits towards a communication skills badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Identifies key information in a presentation, Uses key words, images and symbols to represent ideas and information.
Uses simple fonts, images and symbols. Uses design elements & principles to present information graphically.
Creates graphic recordings using digital or non-digital tools to capture messages for own learning. Uses digital and non-digital tools to create graphic recordings to communicate learning.

e532a761-eeda-4baf-91d6-0c42e0e24175.description: The House Captain is awarded the portfolio badge, signalling a recognition of their journey to hold the position. The School House Captain is a significant leadership position with the School, which leads a portfolio of captains and works directly with both the Deputy Head of Senior School – Co-Curricular Programs, Head of Music, Head of Sport, Head of Drama and Heads of House. The position encompasses a range of roles and duties both within the School and the wider community.
e532a761-eeda-4baf-91d6-0c42e0e24175.name: House Captain | Singleton (Portfolio)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Students must be able to evidence the following to be considered for this position: • Active participation in House events and activities throughout your time at Camberwell Girls. • Achievement of House Badge.

• Demonstrating a commitment to the role by regularly meeting with Heads of House and House Captains, and other relevant staff, regarding their role and promotion of House events. This promotion may take the form of written articles for newsletters, writing presentations / announcements for assemblies, creating and implementing House Programs such as House Round Robin, House Spirit Week, House Mentoring and new House activities.

• In conjunction with relevant staff, show initiative by supporting all House Captains and Programs (including House Visual Art, Dance, Debating/Public Speaking, Drama, Music, Sport, Technical and Literature Captains) to fulfil their roles and responsibilities by offering advice, guidance and assistance when needed. • Promotion and compering various House Events, in conjunction with other School and House Positions.

• Purposeful contact and support of each House, offering guidance for all Houses equally and stepping in when the need arises, ensuring a distributed leadership model. • Assisting the Deputy Heads of Senior School – Co-Curricular and Student Wellbeing, and Heads of House to develop and implement the School House Mentor Program including session planning, attendance, oversee allocation of students and evaluation of the program.

• Assisting the Deputy Heads of Senior School – Co-Curricular and Heads of House to develop and implement the School House Round Robin Program including scheduling, attendance, oversee allocation of students and evaluation of the program. • Assisting the Deputy Heads of Senior School – Co-Curricular and Heads of House to develop and implement the School House Spirit Week program including session planning, oversee allocation of students and evaluation of the program.

badge_template_activities.title: • Meeting with the Principal and /or Deputy Principal/Head of Senior School regularly to plan and review events, as well as share information or discuss concerns. • Leading and communicating with the community including, but not limited to, Assemblies, Presentation Evening Speeches, Church Services, Information Mornings and Open Days (including hosting duties), writing for CamNews and CamLife. • Assistance with the organisation of School events

A focus on positive leadership that incorporates respect, trust, enthusiasm, politeness and discretion where required. • A commitment to support and promote connectivity across the whole School. • Being a role model for students both within the School and the wider community. • Influencing and supporting all Captains and the Year 12 cohort as leaders of the School, supporting and engaging students’ participation in activities - Development and organisation of a community theme

badge_template_activities.title: • Meeting with the Principal and /or Deputy Principal/Head of Senior School regularly to plan and review events, as well as share information or discuss concerns. • Leading and communicating with the community including, but not limited to, Assemblies, Presentation Evening Speeches, Church Services, Information Mornings and Open Days (including hosting duties), writing for CamNews and CamLife. • Assistance with the organisation of School events

• A focus on positive leadership that incorporates respect, trust, enthusiasm, politeness and discretion where required. • A commitment to support and promote connectivity across the whole School. • Being a role model for students both within the School and the wider community. • Influencing and supporting all Captains and the Year 12 cohort as leaders of the School, supporting and engaging students’ participation in activities Development and organisation of a community theme

9669ae25-e460-479f-a0e2-1961f9e97385.description: The School Debating & Public Speaking Captain is awarded the portfolio badge, signalling a recognition of their journey to hold the position. The School Debating & Public Speaking Captain is a significant leadership position with the School, which leads a portfolio of captains and works directly with both the Head of English and the Debating Coordinator. The position encompasses a range of roles and duties both within the School and the wider community.
9669ae25-e460-479f-a0e2-1961f9e97385.name: School Debating & Public Speaking Captain (Portfolio)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Students must be able to evidence the following to be considered for this position: The Captain must have Demonstrated contributions to House Debating and Public Speaking, DAV Debating and/or OGA Public Speaking events throughout their time at Camberwell Girls.

- Coordinating the House Debating competition with the assistance of House Debating Captains and the Head of English. - Liaising regularly with the Head of English to source and promote external debating and public speaking competitions for students - Promoting and assisting in the organisation of debating and public speaking activities throughout the School, including DAV Debating, House Debating and Public Speaking - Informing the school community on debating and public speaking events

4015c9c1-3f8e-4902-a35d-ac8befc22e1c.description: The School Drama Captain is awarded the portfolio badge, signalling a recognition of their journey to hold the position. The School Drama Captain is a significant leadership position with the School, which leads a portfolio of captains and works directly with both the Head of Drama and Heads of House. The position encompasses a range of roles and duties both within the School and the wider community.
4015c9c1-3f8e-4902-a35d-ac8befc22e1c.name: School Drama Captain (Portfolio)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Students must be able to evidence the following to be considered for this position: • Pro-active participation in previous House and School productions throughout their time at Camberwell Girls. • Achievement of School Drama Badge.

• Demonstrating a commitment to the role by regularly meeting with members of the Drama Department, and other relevant staff, regarding the role and promotion of House Dance and Drama events. This promotion may take the form of written articles for newsletters, writing presentations / announcements for assemblies, creating and maintaining a positive social media profile for the department to the wider School Community.

In conjunction with staff, supporting House Dance, Music, Drama, Technical and Visual Art Captains to respond to a thematic prompt in order to create elements of their performance for the House events. This may also include assisting with auditions, providing feedback or offering support during rehearsals.

• Compering the House Dance and Drama, together with the School House Captain. • Purposeful contact and support of each House, offering guidance for all Houses equally and stepping in when the need arises.

• Supporting all aspects of the School Production process, leading by example in the way they approach rehearsals (in which ever capacity they choose to work; acting, assistant direction or design), taking the initiative to guide other members of the ensemble when needed and without needing to be asked.

It is expected that the School Drama Captain and Technical Captain take the initiative to touch base with the Performing Arts teachers to offer assistance and keep track of all performances throughout the year. This is a pro-active role

a61e1848-29c4-4b59-bb80-b0b0967f49c0.description: The School Faith & Service Captain is awarded the portfolio badge, signalling a recognition of their journey to hold the position. The School Faith and Service Captain is a significant leadership position with the School, which leads a portfolio of captains and works directly with both the Head of Service Learning and School Chaplain. The position encompasses a range of roles and duties both within the School and the wider community.
a61e1848-29c4-4b59-bb80-b0b0967f49c0.name: School Faith & Service Captain (Portfolio)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Students must be able to evidence the following to be considered for this position: • A personal commitment to the service of others, the environment and respect for the Christian foundations of the School. • An ability to articulate the connection between the Christian foundation of the School and our commitment to service. • Achievement of School Service Badge.
• Demonstrating a commitment to the role by regularly meeting with the School Chaplain, the Head of Service Learning and the Deputy Head of Senior School – Co-Curricular Programs.

• In conjunction with relevant staff, meeting regularly with the captains within this portfolio, to support planning for the short and the long term. • Meeting regularly with the captains within this portfolio, to encourage communication and understanding between the particular captains.

• Articulating to the student community, the connection between the Faith Foundations of the School and our commitment to service. • Displaying a positive attitude towards Christian Worship within the School. • Demonstrated and visible support in the initiatives of the captains in the portfolio by supporting the planning, delivery and advertising of their events.

f069ab48-5a71-4a1f-b242-f460fe3f9be7.description: The School Music (co-curricular & house) Captain is awarded the portfolio badge, signalling a recognition of their journey to hold the position. 4a19632d-dcda-49ba-88f1-f7843c298e74.description: Technical Badge - Earners of the Barista Skills credential have developed industry skills which enable them to serve the community and get involved in industry. They use initiative, communication as well as planning & organisation alongside an industry expert to earn this badge. Students made 9 unique types of espresso coffee • Roasting • Grinder maintenance and adjustments • Time extractions & machine operations • Frothing and texturing milk • Trouble shooting • Latte / Coffee art
4a19632d-dcda-49ba-88f1-f7843c298e74.name: Barista Skills (Technical)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

80def6a5-37a4-459c-81b2-76bba6d0b3ef.description: Earners of the Graphic Recording credential have developed critical thinking and communication skills which enable them to extract key information and make links between ideas and concepts in presentations, videos or written text. They use design elements and principles to make connections and highlight information in terms of importance. Their graphic recordings reflect their own unique recording style and creative flair.
80def6a5-37a4-459c-81b2-76bba6d0b3ef.name: Graphic Recording | Advanced (Technical)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

alignments.name: CGGS Learning Design Framework
alignments.description: This badge provides 1 credit towards a critical thinking skills badge and 2 credits towards a communication skills badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Highlights the most important information. Uses key words, images and symbols to represent ideas and information

Uses attributes such as colour, size and position as well as image and symbol choice to highlight information according to importance. Uses design elements & principles to present information graphically.

Creates graphic recordings using preferred tools and their own creative flair and style  to capture messages, links and  hierarchies of importance to share with others. Uses digital and non-digital tools to create graphic recordings to communicate learning.

9a23cd16-d57a-4531-9d4d-9556a5b2611b.description: The House Captain is awarded the portfolio badge, signalling a recognition of their journey to hold the position. The School House Captain is a significant leadership position with the School, which leads a portfolio of captains and works directly with both the Deputy Head of Senior School – Co-Curricular Programs, Head of Music, Head of Sport, Head of Drama and Heads of House. The position encompasses a range of roles and duties both within the School and the wider community.
9a23cd16-d57a-4531-9d4d-9556a5b2611b.name: House Captain | Lawrence (Portfolio)

issuer.summary: issued by Camberwell Girls Grammar School

badge_template_activities.title: Students must be able to evidence the following to be considered for this position: • Active participation in House events and activities throughout your time at Camberwell Girls. • Achievement of House Badge.

• Demonstrating a commitment to the role by regularly meeting with Heads of House and House Captains, and other relevant staff, regarding their role and promotion of House events. This promotion may take the form of written articles for newsletters, writing presentations / announcements for assemblies, creating and implementing House Programs such as House Round Robin, House Spirit Week, House Mentoring and new House activities.

• In conjunction with relevant staff, show initiative by supporting all House Captains and Programs (including House Visual Art, Dance, Debating/Public Speaking, Drama, Music, Sport, Technical and Literature Captains) to fulfil their roles and responsibilities by offering advice, guidance and assistance when needed. • Promotion and compering various House Events, in conjunction with other School and House Positions.

• Purposeful contact and support of each House, offering guidance for all Houses equally and stepping in when the need arises, ensuring a distributed leadership model. • Assisting the Deputy Heads of Senior School – Co-Curricular and Student Wellbeing, and Heads of House to develop and implement the School House Mentor Program including session planning, attendance, oversee allocation of students and evaluation of the program.

• Assisting the Deputy Heads of Senior School – Co-Curricular and Heads of House to develop and implement the School House Round Robin Program including scheduling, attendance, oversee allocation of students and evaluation of the program. • Assisting the Deputy Heads of Senior School – Co-Curricular and Heads of House to develop and implement the School House Spirit Week program including session planning, oversee allocation of students and evaluation of the program.
